templates.description:
This container sets up an Nginx webserver and reverse proxy with php support and a built-in letsencrypt client that automates free SSL server certificate generation and renewal processes. It also contains fail2ban for intrusion prevention.
  
  Before running this container, make sure that the url and subdomains are properly forwarded to this container's host.
  
  - Port 443 on the internet side of the router should be forwarded to this container's port 443.
  - If you need a dynamic dns provider, you can use the free provider duckdns.org where the url will be yoursubdomain.duckdns.org and the subdomains    can be www,ftp,cloud
  - The container detects changes to url and subdomains, revokes existing certs and generates new ones during start. 
  - It also detects changes to the DHLEVEL parameter and replaces the dhparams file.
  
  - If you'd like to password protect your sites, you can use htpasswd. Run the following command on your host to generate the htpasswd file docker exec -it letsencrypt htpasswd -c /config/nginx/.htpasswd <username>
templates.name: letsencrypt
templates.title: Let's Encrypt

templates.title: LibreSpeed

/config : AppData Location

templates.description:
Duck DNS is a free service which will point a DNS (sub domains of duckdns.org) to an IP of your choice. The service is completely free, and doesn't require reactivation or forum posts to maintain its existence.

First, go to duckdns site, register your subdomain and retrieve your token
Then run the docker create command above with your subdomain(s) and token
It will update your IP with the DuckDNS service every 5 minutes
templates.name: duckdns
templates.title: Duck DNS

templates.description: This small Alpine Linux based Docker image will allow you to use the free CloudFlare DNS Service as a Dynamic DNS Provider (DDNS).
templates.note: Follow the steps at https://github.com/oznu/docker-cloudflare-ddns#creating-a-cloudflare-api-token to generate a proper API Token for Cloudflare.

env.label: API_KEY
env.name: API_KEY
env.description: Your CloudFlare scoped API token. Follow the steps in the information section above to generate an API Token.

env.label: ZONE
env.name: ZONE
env.description: The DNS zone that DDNS updates should be applied to. Example: example.com

env.label: SUBDOMAIN
env.name: SUBDOMAIN
env.description: A subdomain of the ZONE to write DNS changes to. If this is not supplied the root zone will be used. Example: dynamic

env.label: RRTYPE
env.name: RRTYPE
env.description: Set to AAAA to use set IPv6 records instead of IPv4 records.

env.label: PROXIED
env.name: PROXIED
env.description: Set to true to make traffic go through the CloudFlare CDN.

env.label: DELETE_ON_STOP
env.name: DELETE_ON_STOP
env.description: Set to true to have the DNS record deleted when the container is stopped.

env.label: DNS_SERVER
env.name: DNS_SERVER
env.description: Set to the IP address of the DNS server you would like to use. Defaults to 1.1.1.1 otherwise.

env.label: CUSTOM_LOOKUP_CMD
env.name: CUSTOM_LOOKUP_CMD
env.description: Set to any shell command to run them and have the IP pulled from the standard output. Leave unset to use default IP address detection methods.

templates.name: cloudflare-ddns
templates.title: Cloudflare DDNS

templates.description:
Tautulli is a 3rd party application that you can run along side your Plex Media Server to monitor activity and track various statistics. Most importantly, these statistics include what has been watched, who watched it, when and where they watched it, and how it was watched. All statistics are presented in a nice and clean interface with many tables and graphs, which makes it easy to brag about your server to everyone else.[br][br]
  [b][u][span style='color: #E80000;']Configuration[/span][/u][/b][br]
  [b]8181[/b] The webui for Tautulli's webui [br]
  [b]/config[/b] Storing Configuration and the Tautulli database[br]
[b]/logs[/b] Map to you plex logs (required for IP logging)[br]

templates.description:
Tvheadend is a TV streaming server and recorder for Linux, FreeBSD and Android supporting DVB-S, DVB-S2, DVB-C, DVB-T, ATSC, ISDB-T, IPTV, SAT>IP and HDHomeRun as input sources.
Tvheadend offers the HTTP (VLC, MPlayer), HTSP (Kodi, Movian) and SAT>IP streaming.
Multiple EPG sources are supported (over-the-air DVB and ATSC including OpenTV DVB extensions, XMLTV, PyXML).

templates.description: With watchtower you can update the running version of your containerized app simply by pushing a new image to the Docker Hub or your own image registry. Watchtower will pull down your new image, gracefully shut down your existing container and restart it with the same options that were used when it was deployed initially.

env.label: Time Zone
env.description: Sets the time zone to be used by WatchTower's logs and the optional Cron 'Schedule'.
env.name: TZ

env.label: Cleanup
env.description: Removes old images after updating. When true, watchtower will remove the old image after restarting a container with a new image. Use this option to prevent the accumulation of orphaned images on your system as containers are updated.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_CLEANUP

env.label: Remove Attached Volumes
env.description: Removes attached volumes after updating. When true, watchtower will remove all attached volumes from the container before restarting with a new image. Use this option to force new volumes to be populated as containers are updated.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_REMOVE_VOLUMES

env.label: Docker host
env.description: Docker daemon socket to connect to. Can be pointed at a remote Docker host by specifying a TCP endpoint as 'tcp://hostname:port'.
env.name: DOCKER_HOST

env.label: Docker API version
env.description: The API version to use by the Docker client for connecting to the Docker daemon. The minimum supported version is 1.24.
env.name: DOCKER_API_VERSION

env.label: Include Restarting
env.description: Will also include restarting containers.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_INCLUDE_RESTARTING

env.label: Include Stopped
env.description: Will also include created and exited containers.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_INCLUDE_STOPPED

env.label: Revive Stopped
env.description: Start any stopped containers that have had their image updated. This is only valid if 'Include Stopped' is true.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_REVIVE_STOPPED

env.label: Poll Interval
env.description: Poll interval (in seconds). This value controls how frequently watchtower will poll for new images. Either 'Schedule' or a 'Poll Interval' can be defined, but not both.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_POLL_INTERVAL

env.label: Label Enable
env.description: Only update containers that have a 'com.centurylinklabs.watchtower.enable' label set to true.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_LABEL_ENABLE

env.label: Without Updating Containers
env.description: Will only monitor for new images, send notifications and invoke the pre-check/post-check hooks, but will not update the containers.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_MONITOR_ONLY

env.label: Without Restarting Containers
env.description: Do not restart containers after updating. This option can be useful when the start of the containers is managed by an external system such as systemd.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_NO_RESTART

env.label: Without Pulling New Images
env.description: Do not pull new images. When this is true, watchtower will not attempt to pull new images from the registry. Instead it will only monitor the local image cache for changes. Use this option if you are building new images directly on the Docker host without pushing them to a registry.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_NO_PULL

env.label: Without Sending A Startup Message
env.description: Do not send a message after watchtower started. Otherwise there will be an info-level notification.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_NO_STARTUP_MESSAGE

env.label: Run Once
env.description: Run an update attempt against a container name list one time immediately and exit.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_RUN_ONCE

env.label: HTTP API Mode
env.description: Runs Watchtower in HTTP API mode, only allowing image updates to be triggered by an HTTP request. For details see HTTP API. Add WATCHTOWER_HTTP_API_TOKEN env variable to set an authentication token.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_HTTP_API

env.label: HTTP API Metrics
env.description: Enables a metrics endpoint, exposing prometheus metrics via HTTP. See Metrics for details.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_HTTP_API_METRICS

env.label: Rolling Restart
env.description: Restart one image at time instead of stopping and starting all at once. Useful in conjunction with lifecycle hooks to implement zero-downtime deploy.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_ROLLING_RESTART

env.label: Wait Until Timeout
env.description: Timeout before the container is forcefully stopped.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_TIMEOUT

env.label: TLS Verification
env.description: Use TLS when connecting to the Docker socket and verify the server's certificate.
env.name: DOCKER_TLS_VERIFY

env.label: HEAD Failure Warnings
env.description: When to warn about HEAD pull requests failing. Auto means that it will warn when the registry is known to handle the requests and may rate limit pull requests (mainly docker.io).
env.name: WATCHTOWER_WARN_ON_HEAD_FAILURE

env.label: Debug
env.description: Enable debug mode with verbose logging.
env.name: WATCHTOWER_DEBUG

env.label: Trace
env.description: Enable trace mode with very verbose logging. Caution: exposes credentials!
env.name: WATCHTOWER_TRACE

env.label: ANSI Colors
env.description: Disable ANSI color escape codes in log output.
env.name: NO_COLOR

templates.name: watchtower
templates.note: It is recommended to manually update your containers but we're including this for those of you that don't care
templates.title: Watchtower

templates.description:
WebGrab+Plus is a multi-site incremental xmltv epg grabber. It collects tv-program guide data from selected tvguide sites for your favourite channels.[br]
		Optional postprocessors to add IMDb data or to customize your xmltv listing.[br]
		http://www.webgrabplus.com/[br]
		[b][span style='color: #E80000;']Directions:[/span][/b][br]
		[b]/config[/b] : This is where WebGrab+Plus will store it's configuration.[br][br]
		[b]/data[/b] : This is where tv_grab_wg script in the Tvheadend container looks for the guide.xml file.[br][br]

templates.title: WebGrab+Plus

env.description: Automatically initializes a database with the name of this environment variable.
env.label: InfluxDB Database Name
env.name: INFLUXDB_DB

env.description: Enables authentication. Either this must be set or auth-enabled = true must be set within the configuration file for any authentication related options below to work.
env.label: InfluxDB HTTP Auth Enabled
env.name: INFLUXDB_HTTP_AUTH_ENABLED

env.description: The name of the admin user to be created. If this is unset, no admin user is created.
env.label: InfluxDB Admin User
env.name: INFLUXDB_ADMIN_USER

env.description: The password for the admin user configured with INFLUXDB_ADMIN_USER. If this is unset, a random password is generated and printed to standard out.
env.label: InfluxDB Admin Password
env.name: INFLUXDB_ADMIN_PASSWORD

env.description: The name of a user to be created with no privileges. If INFLUXDB_DB is set, this user will be granted read and write permissions for that database.
env.label: InfluxDB User
env.name: INFLUXDB_USER

env.description: The password for the user configured with INFLUXDB_USER. If this is unset, a random password is generated and printed to standard out.
env.label: InfluxDB User Password
env.name: INFLUXDB_USER_PASSWORD

env.description: The name of a user to be created with read privileges on INFLUXDB_DB. If INFLUXDB_DB is not set, this user will have no granted permissions.
env.label: InfluxDB Read User
env.name: INFLUXDB_READ_USER

env.description: The password for the user configured with INFLUXDB_READ_USER. If this is unset, a random password is generated and printed to standard out.
env.label: InfluxDB Read User Password
env.name: INFLUXDB_READ_USER_PASSWORD

env.description: The name of a user to be created with write privileges on INFLUXDB_DB. If INFLUXDB_DB is not set, this user will have no granted permissions.
env.label: InfluxDB Write User
env.name: INFLUXDB_WRITE_USER

env.description: The password for the user configured with INFLUXDB_WRITE_USER. If this is unset, a random password is generated and printed to standard out.
env.label: InfluxDB Write User Password
env.name: INFLUXDB_WRITE_USER_PASSWORD
